Gang Lisa Sent Tuesday June PM To Sewell Doug Subject FW MID C Question Original Message From Luong Steven Sent Tuesday June AM To Gang Lisa Subject RE MID C Question Thanks Original Message From Gang Lisa Sent Tuesday June AM To Luong Steven Subject RE MID C Question is a fixed rate per MW It is a semi daily and monthly purchase In other words we buy it daily however they understand we need it on a monthly basis The price is the same for daily or monthly It seems rare we get cut on this transmission Ive been here for about months now and we have yet to be cut on this transmission This coming summer may be a different story Air Products is a MondayThursday deal We are currently purchasing at Midc to fill the position for Tuesday and Wednesday Hope this helps Lisa Original Message From Luong Steven Sent Monday June PM To Gang Lisa Cc Sewell Doug Subject RE MID C Question Thanks Lisa Is the a fixed rate for every month or does it vary Also do we buy that daily monthly or longer term than that Are there ever any problems with availability of the transmission history of curtailments Finally what do we do with the extra power on the days Air Products doesnt take it I think I remember the deal being for every day but Tuesdays and Wed or something strange like that I know that is a lot of questions Thanks for your help Steve Original Message From Sewell Doug Sent Monday June PM To Luong Steven Subject FW MID C Question here you go Original Message From Gang Lisa Sent Monday June PM To Sewell Doug Subject FW MID C Question I purchase Snohomish Transmission to deliver power from MID C to Montana sys The Transmission cost is per mw This cost is added in addition to the power price at MID C The Air Products deal is at MID C We fill this position by purchasing at MID C I hope this helps Lisa Original Message From Luong Steven Sent Monday June PM To Gang Lisa Cc Irani Eric Subject MID C Question Hi Lisa I am working on a Hedging Activity Report that will be sent to EY on a weekly basis I think Mo is out of the office so I heard that you might be the right person to ask for help For the first week I am using a spreadsheet that Mo sent where he bought some July power at MID C It looks like the MID C power along with our NW Del length makes us flat for July at MID C and Montana System Border as well My questions are How does power flow between MID C and the other delivery points like Montana Do we incur a transmission cost on top of what he bought the power for We are actually a little long MWh bc of the Air Products deal that is a little unique what happens to this length If its easier to explain over the phone please give me a call at Thanks for your help Steve

Manual WireCheck Requestspst Please give all requests to Drew Kanellopoulos or Stephan Plauche in my absence during the week of Thanks ds

Manual WireCheck Requests Cc po Folks Starting Monday manual wire requests will have to go through the Cash Management Committee CMC the day before payment This means that the request forms and accompanying support documentation will have to be signed by the appropriate signatories of the business unit BU the BU CAO and the BU Head and delivered to myself at EBN a or Drew Kanellopoulos the day before the CMC meeting For example if you need a wire sent on Wednesday you would need to deliver the request to us by the end of the day on Monday so the request could be reviewed at the CMC meeting Check requests should be delivered three days in advance The only exceptions to this process will be items such as same day payment for prepay commodities We appreciate you helping us relieve the incredible stress on the system to get payments more efficiently and please pass this on to anyone I have missed Regards Doug

FW Please see attachedpst Original Message From Rodriguez Ramona Sent Wednesday February PM To Sewell Doug Subject Please see attached Doug This was sent at today Thanks Ramona NONCHECK FINANCIAL DATA FOR REF ACCOUNT ENRON CORPECT CASH SVC AMOUNT POST DATE VALUE DATE CODE BATCHTRACK DUP TRANSACTION DESCRIPTION SAME DAY DR TRANSFER GIDLCT FEDBQC REF S ORDER ENA CASH SERVICES CR BK ID CR BK JPMORGAN CHASE BANK FORMERLY TEXAS COMMERCE BANK NA HOUSTON TX BENEF RELIANT ENERGY SERVICE S INC PO BOX HOUSTON TX US USER REFS DETAILSWT RELIANT S INSTRUCT DATE ADVICE TYPEMAIL ENTER

RE Reliant Cc Don Miller asked me what contract we would be using Can someone give me that information We also need to know if there is any risk of Reliant netting the payment against any prepetition obligations If the current contract doesnt address the netting issue or any other performance issues we need to get a contract in place that will Original Message From Moran Tom Sent Monday February AM To Boyt Eric Mann Kay Cc Germany Chris Sewell Doug Schneider Chip Subject RE Reliant Eric I do not have a concern about the credit quality of Reliant concerning this transaction Enron does have performance risk but it seems minimal and I would recommend that we prepay Reliant the Regards Tom Moran Original Message From Boyt Eric Sent Monday February AM To Mann Kay Moran Tom Cc Germany Chris Sewell Doug Schneider Chip Subject Reliant KayTom I need legal and credit signoff for ENA to prepay Reliant for gas needed to perform under the City of Tallahassee contract approx MM in the money to Enron The prepay would be for mmbtuday x days x Gas Daily appox This would give us days worth of swing gas prepaid with Reliant Questions Are you concerned about Credit Are you concerned about the risk they may take our money and not perform by claiming an offset against other monies owed by ENA Kay where can I find you to get you the contract to review Please get back to us today as we need to get the Cash Approval Sheet to the credit committee this afternoon Thanks so much Eric PS Chris is also working on another backup supplier for this deal

Alliant Agency RelationshipJust wanted to keep you in the loop I would be interested in your thoughts on the separate passwords Regards Doug Forwarded by Doug SewellHOUECT on PM SHARI STACK PM To Doug CT cc Terri CT Edward nronXGate Subject Alliant Agency Relationship Doug As discussed at the absolute minimum we need the following from Alliant in order to do EOL trades as well as longer dated OTC trades Written evidence that Steve Castleburg is an authorized signatory for each of the utilities and AECS see below In addition I would like for Alliant Energy Corporate Services to sign the Consent and Acknowledgment letter as well I am not sure why a signature space was not provided for them on the document Anyway it is on our system and easy to generate a revised letter with a signature space for AECS Also as discussed in order for us to give Alliant the best credit line possible here is our wish list from most desirable downwards What this means is that if Alliant is willing to do then they will get the best line possible If they do then the line will be somewhat decreased and so on Separate EOL applications and passwords for each individual utility who is appointing Alliant as agent ie a total of individual passwords Also a separate Consent and Acknowledgment for each will need to be signed by AECS and the relevant utility Alliant identifies at the time of transacting which utility the transaction is for Alliant sends us an allocation schedule at the end of each month which shows which transaction is for which utility This is the procedure we follow with all utility agency relationships we are not singling out Alliant I can promise you that Please let me know if you have any questions Thanks Shari

FW MAY HOUSTON TO ST LOUIS ROBERT SEWELL TICKETEDOriginal Message From Shoemake Lisa Sent Tuesday April PM To Sewell Doug Subject MAY HOUSTON TO ST LOUIS ROBERT SEWELL TICKETED Here are your arrangements Please let me know if I can be of any further assistance Thanks Lisa x Forwarded by Lisa ShoemakeHOUECT on PM sandra delgado on PM To LISA NRONCOM cc Subject MAY HOUSTON TO ST LOUIS ROBERT SEWELL TICKETED AGENT JHSS BOOKING REF YWCJ SEWELLROBERT DOUGLAS ENRON SMITH HOUSTON TX LISA SHOEMAKE X DATE APR ENRON SERVICE DATE FROM TO DEPART ARRIVE CONTINENTAL AIRLINES MAY HOUSTON TX ST LOUIS MO P P CO Q TUE GBUSH INTERCO LAMBERT TERMINAL C TERMINAL M NON STOP RESERVATION CONFIRMED DURATION AIRCRAFT BOEING SEAT D NO SMOKING CONFIRMED SEWELLROBERT D CAR MAY BUDGET ST LOUIS MO MAY CONFIRMATION US TELEPHONE FULL DOOR CAR AUTOMATIC AIR RATE USDDY UNL MI DY BASE RATE UNL RATE GUARANTEED PICKUP LAMBERTST LOUIS INTL APT ST LOUIS DROPOFF LAMBERTST LOUIS INTL APT ST LOUIS ZD CONTINENTAL AIRLINES MAY ST LOUIS MO HOUSTON TX P P CO Q WED LAMBERT GBUSH INTERCO TERMINAL M TERMINAL C NON STOP RESERVATION CONFIRMED DURATION FLIGHT OPERATED BY CONTINENTAL EXPRESS AIRCRAFT EMBRAER EMB SEAT A NO SMOKING CONFIRMED SEWELLROBERT D AIR FARE TAX TOTAL USD AIR TOTAL USD INVOICE TOTAL USD PAYMENT CCVIA RESERVATION NUMBERS COJSZP SEWELLROBERT DOUGLAS TICKETCOETKT CO FREQUENT FLYER COWY CONTINENTAL RECORD LOCATOR JSZP THIS IS A TICKETLESS RESERVATION PLEASE HAVE A PICTURE ID AVAILABLE AT THE AIRPORT THANK YOU NONREFUNDABLE TKT MINIMUM CHANGE FEE THANK YOU FOR CALLING VITOL TRAVEL Do You Yahoo Get email at your own domain with Yahoo Mail

FW MAINMAPPSPPthis guy at the MAPPMAINSPP conference in Chicago Larry V says they are on the credit watch list but I thought you might want to check it out anyway ds Original Message From Edwin Ditto ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESEdwinDittoCEDittoedisonmissionEcomE NRONcom Sent Monday May AM To Subject MAINMAPPSPP Dougthanks for the hospitality last Tuesday night at Pheasant RunI enjoyed hanging out with you and Mike On our conversation about trading around MAPPour assets in the Chicago area are in an excellent position to be accessible to MidAmerican and Alliant and if youd like to have your spot traders start calling us on our realtime desk at wed welcome the calls Although I think you may find some reluctance on your side to get done with us clearly we can supply odd lots and loadfollowing schedules into MAPPand hopefully that gets us some leverage If youre willing to undertake payables to us were more than happy to accept them Thanks again Ed Ditto Director Midwestern Power Operations EMMT

Tenaska Service Agreement Cc PST Hey Tom Rita Wynne just called and let me know that we need to make a payment to TXU on behalf of Tenaska Since TXU has terminated agreements with us the Cash Management Committee will not make payments to TXU unless they understand the deal that is in place with Tenaska and we show that Tenaska has already paid us their part Could you please help Chip Schneider of Enron Underwriting and myself get up to speed on this as quickly as possible TXU is threatening to take action on Tenaska Thanks for your help Regards Doug Sewell
RE Duke Field Servicespst no chip no money Original Message From Parks Joe Sent Wednesday March AM To Sewell Doug Subject Duke Field Services Doug money yes

Williams Robert Brownfeld Gail Oliver Shirley Subject OCP Update As of this morning Weil informs that the court has not yet approved the o rder for theordinary course professionals so even the original list of ven dors that has been before the court for upwards of a month is not approved Weil says that the court might approve the order today but we just have to wait and see Once the court issues the order the vendors still must c omplete a form of affidavit to submit to the court to complete the process We have not yet been given the form of affidavit I attach the following original list of vendors that is before the court for approval doc sdoc the current supplement list of proposed vendors which has not been subm itted to the court so far as I know but which has been approved by the int ernal bankruptcy management committee for submission to the court doc sup plement matrix markeddoc a grid for you to complete and send back to to me if you want to get add itional law firms or other professionals engineers accountants appraiser s other professional persons approved or if you want to send additional assignments to an OCP on the existing lists as the OCPs apparently get ap proved for specific limited scopes The criteria so far on for OCPs subje ct to whatever the aproved order will say is that the OCP is limited to a monthly budgte of k over an average of months and no more than k per case If you think your budget will exceed that then we need to talk Depending on what Weil says I would think the work should either be give n to an existing specially retained profession or if they cant handle the job due to expertise issues perhaps another specially retained profession al filing will nbeed to ne made In addition to filing out the grid the bankruptcy management committee wil l require that you be able to state thenew OCP you propose is not a related party Enron and affilaited personsparties do not have ecomonic interests in the proposed OCP and vice versa You should do that in your email tr ansmitting the completed grid back to me doc OCP supplement addition gri ddoc

FW Duke Control Area Certificationfyi Doug Sewell Enron Midwest Origination Work Fax Original Message From Larry J Kezele mailto Sent Tuesday October PM To Cc Subject Duke Control Area Certification To MAIN Operating Committee and Member Representatives In accordance with the directive of the MAIN Operating Committee at their April meeting the Chair has today approved conditional certification for the Duke Energy Audrain Control Area All NERC and MAIN processes are in place for this new Control Area to begin operations Larry Kezele MAIN Director of Operations

RE NERC and SecurityI was on a MAIN Planning Committee conference call this morning concerning Electric System Security This a technical group so I was probably overlooked as being a marketer Naturally the discussion revolved around potential targets and how to protect them from terrorist attacks The part that was disturbing was their desire to severely limit information that is currently in the public domain I relayed that I understood the need to protect critical grid components but limiting all information was equally damaging economically Some comments made implied that you cant tell who has the information with marketers because they change jobs so much and you need to keep info from people with loose lips There was no direct comment linking marketers and loose lips but the whole undertone was that information might not be as safe with marketers I have asked Andy to work with on a response to MAIN MIC and NERC ds Doug Sewell Enron Midwest Origination Work Fax Original Message From Rodriquez Andy Sent Tuesday October PM To Yeung Charles Steffes James D Shapiro Richard Bestard Jose Cc Sewell Doug Nicolay Christi L Subject NERC and Security NERC is apparently moving forward aggressively on their initiative to restrict access to market information Doug Sewell who participates on the MAIN Planning Committee was on a call this morning in which members of MAIN and NERCs Virginia Sulzberger discussed ways to limit access to information A new disturbing angle was that apparently some members indirectly alleged that marketers have higher turnover and loose lips and were using this as a scare tactic to indicate why the information should be restricted potentially even from legitimate consumers like us If I remember correctly we were going to contact NERC to let them know our opinions on this issue It sounds like perhaps they are not being addressed sufficiently Doug has suggested we should being it up at the MAIN MIC meeting do we want to begin a campaign to protect our access to this data I think that without getting more involved this will be yet another industry de facto standard that is created under the assumption that silence is consent even if were not told about the changes We should probably talk about this all today on our conference call Andy Rodriquez Regulatory Affairs Enron Corp

RE NERC and Security Cc The comment about loose lips was a general comment I felt the undertone in general was to leave marketers out of the process Doug Sewell Enron Midwest Origination Work Fax Original Message From Bestard Jose Sent Tuesday October PM To Rodriquez Andy Cc Yeung Charles Steffes James D Shapiro Richard Sewell Doug Nicolay Christi L Subject Re NERC and Security Andy Can you put a letter with the facts As a starter I want to send a letter directly to NERC raising our concerns There should be no limitations that hinders the marketers ability to engage in commerce Jose From Andy nronXgate on PM To Charles nronXgate James D nronXgate Richard nronXgate Jose BestardENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Doug nronXgate Christi L nronXgate Subject NERC and Security NERC is apparently moving forward aggressively on their initiative to restrict access to market information Doug Sewell who participates on the MAIN Planning Committee was on a call this morning in which members of MAIN and NERCs Virginia Sulzberger discussed ways to limit access to information A new disturbing angle was that apparently some members indirectly alleged that marketers have higher turnover and loose lips and were using this as a scare tactic to indicate why the information should be restricted potentially even from legitimate consumers like us If I remember correctly we were going to contact NERC to let them know our opinions on this issue It sounds like perhaps they are not being addressed sufficiently Doug has suggested we should being it up at the MAIN MIC meeting do we want to begin a campaign to protect our access to this data I think that without getting more involved this will be yet another industry de facto standard that is created under the assumption that silence is consent even if were not told about the changes We should probably talk about this all today on our conference call Andy Rodriquez Regulatory Affairs Enron Corp

RE NERC and Security Cc The comment about loose lips was a general comment I felt the undertone in general was to leave marketers out of the process Doug Sewell Enron Midwest Origination Work Fax Original Message From Bestard Jose Sent Tuesday October PM To Rodriquez Andy Cc Yeung Charles Steffes James D Shapiro Richard Sewell Doug Nicolay Christi L Subject Re NERC and Security Andy Can you put a letter with the facts As a starter I want to send a letter directly to NERC raising our concerns There should be no limitations that hinders the marketers ability to engage in commerce Jose From Andy nronXgate on PM To Charles nronXgate James D nronXgate Richard nronXgate Jose BestardENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Doug nronXgate Christi L nronXgate Subject NERC and Security NERC is apparently moving forward aggressively on their initiative to restrict access to market information Doug Sewell who participates on the MAIN Planning Committee was on a call this morning in which members of MAIN and NERCs Virginia Sulzberger discussed ways to limit access to information A new disturbing angle was that apparently some members indirectly alleged that marketers have higher turnover and loose lips and were using this as a scare tactic to indicate why the information should be restricted potentially even from legitimate consumers like us If I remember correctly we were going to contact NERC to let them know our opinions on this issue It sounds like perhaps they are not being addressed sufficiently Doug has suggested we should being it up at the MAIN MIC meeting do we want to begin a campaign to protect our access to this data I think that without getting more involved this will be yet another industry de facto standard that is created under the assumption that silence is consent even if were not told about the changes We should probably talk about this all today on our conference call Andy Rodriquez Regulatory Affairs Enron Corp

RE NERC and SecurityI was on a MAIN Planning Committee conference call this morning concerning Electric System Security This a technical group so I was probably overlooked as being a marketer Naturally the discussion revolved around potential targets and how to protect them from terrorist attacks The part that was disturbing was their desire to severely limit information that is currently in the public domain I relayed that I understood the need to protect critical grid components but limiting all information was equally damaging economically Some comments made implied that you cant tell who has the information with marketers because they change jobs so much and you need to keep info from people with loose lips There was no direct comment linking marketers and loose lips but the whole undertone was that information might not be as safe with marketers I have asked Andy to work with on a response to MAIN MIC and NERC ds Doug Sewell Enron Midwest Origination Work Fax Original Message From Rodriquez Andy Sent Tuesday October PM To Yeung Charles Steffes James D Shapiro Richard Bestard Jose Cc Sewell Doug Nicolay Christi L Subject NERC and Security NERC is apparently moving forward aggressively on their initiative to restrict access to market information Doug Sewell who participates on the MAIN Planning Committee was on a call this morning in which members of MAIN and NERCs Virginia Sulzberger discussed ways to limit access to information A new disturbing angle was that apparently some members indirectly alleged that marketers have higher turnover and loose lips and were using this as a scare tactic to indicate why the information should be restricted potentially even from legitimate consumers like us If I remember correctly we were going to contact NERC to let them know our opinions on this issue It sounds like perhaps they are not being addressed sufficiently Doug has suggested we should being it up at the MAIN MIC meeting do we want to begin a campaign to protect our access to this data I think that without getting more involved this will be yet another industry de facto standard that is created under the assumption that silence is consent even if were not told about the changes We should probably talk about this all today on our conference call Andy Rodriquez Regulatory Affairs Enron Corp

Fed Reference Number for EntergyKoch Wires Cc PST Cathy Please have someone in your group email myself and Mike Carson with the Fed Reference Number for each wire we send for delivery by am CST We need the reference number by am so we can call the counterpart and sooth their nerves It will tenuous for a little while until we build their confidence that we will consistently pay Thanks for your help Doug

EntergyKoch Trading DeadlinePST EntergyKoch has put a requirement on doing transactions with us which requires that wires from EPMI must be received by am CST on the day of purchase In order to facilitate the am deadline Treasury needs the full approval packet by no later than am The physical packet paperwork will need to be to Don Miller give to me ECS and Ill run it through by am We will need the wire request and Cash Use Approval Request form from Evelyn Aucoins group and the price justification spreadsheet from Corry Bentley Im working with Treasury to get notification of the Fed Reference number by Thanks for your help Doug

FW ENA Cash Approval Process MeetingMark I dont think you have any capital expenditures but youre welcome to join in on the call I sent the invoices over to Susan Helton in accounting She is going to help get the requests done Things are still quite fluid and the ipayit system is up so I hear Original Message From Sewell Doug Sent Thursday December AM To Sewell Doug Bartlett Jeff Coffey Jr Jim Colwell Wes Comeaux Keith Irvin Steve Jacoby Ben Larson Bradford Lydecker Jr Richard McMichael Jr Ed Melendrez Jesus Miller Don Asset Mktg Parquet David Plauche Stephen Redmond Brian Thomas Jake Virgo Robert Ward Charles Zisman Stuart Kitagawa Kyle Deane Ryan Cc Collins Angie Subject RE ENA Cash Approval Process Meeting The number to call is passcode see you at am CST Original Message From Sewell Doug Sent Wednesday December PM To Bartlett Jeff Coffey Jr Jim Colwell Wes Comeaux Keith Irvin Steve Jacoby Ben Larson Bradford Lydecker Jr Richard McMichael Jr Ed Melendrez Jesus Miller Don Asset Mktg Parquet David Plauche Stephen Redmond Brian Thomas Jake Virgo Robert Ward Charles Zisman Stuart Kitagawa Kyle Cc Collins Angie Subject ENA Cash Approval Process Meeting Folks Please plan on attending a conference call Thursday morning at am CST to discuss how the cash approval process will be carried out going forward Attached is an example of the day rolling forecast that the Cash Management Committee uses as an agenda Also attached is the Cash Use Approval Request form that will be used for justifying the payment of expenses We will discuss the process and lay out some guidelines for getting things through the Committee and executed as smoothly as possible Houston people will meet in ECS conference room on the lefthand wall as you come into the room I will send out the dialin number tomorrow morning Thanks for your help in this Doug
